intro: Sporoxeia ochthocharioides, commonly known as the red spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
